title: 'I cannot remember a better team spirit' - The last time a Steve Hansen side faced England at the Rugby World Cup
text:
Steve Hansen, the New Zealand head coach, has crossed paths with England at the Rugby World Cup on only one previous occasion ahead of this weekend's semi-final in Yokohama.

On that day in 2003 his Wales side were knocked out in the quarter-finals, but only after giving the future world champions an almighty scare in Brisbane.

“I know Martin Johnson wrote in his autobiography how worried England were at half-time, how tired they were from the pace of the game,” recalls Jonathan Thomas, the Wales No 8 that day.

Hansen famously oversaw Wales’ longest-ever losing streak, 11 matches spanning between November 2002 and August 2003.
